UI_visible_response: Read 26 web pagesView Page DetailsThe Beijing LGBT Center closed due to "force majeure," as stated in its official announcement. This phrase suggests that external, uncontrollable forces led to the closure. The broader context indicates that the center was likely affected by the increasing restrictions and crackdowns on LGBTQ+ organizations and activities in China. In recent years, there has been a significant reduction in the number of LGBTQ+ NGOs, with many being forced to shut down or cease operations. The closure of the Beijing LGBT Center is part of this larger trend, reflecting the challenges faced by the LGBTQ+ community in China.CopyTry AgainShare
traffic_visible_response: The Beijing LGBT Center closed due to "force majeure," as stated in its official announcement[^1^][^4^].
